ARABIC: إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْهِمُ ٱثْنَيْنِ فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَعَزَّزْنَا بِثَالِثٍ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ إِلَيْكُم مُّرْسَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When We sent them two and they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third. They said, 'Truly We have been sent to you as Messengers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When We sent two of them they called them liars; so We sent a third to strengthen them. "We have been sent to you," they said.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We sent to them two Messengers and they rejected both of them as liars. Then We strengthened them with a third (Messenger).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We sent them two Messengers whom they rejected. We supported them by sending a third one who told the people, "We are the Messengers (of God) who have been sent to you".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When We had sent two towards them and they denied them both, so We fortified them with a third, and they all said, “Indeed we have been sent to you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When We sent to them two Messengers, they denied them both; so We reinforced them with a third, and they said: "Verily, we have been sent to you as Messengers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When We sent to them two, they rejected both of them, then We strengthened (them) with a third, so they said: Surely we are apostles to you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: when We sent unto them two men, but they cried them lies, so We sent a third as reinforcement. They said, 'We are assuredly Envoys unto you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When We sent unto them twain, and they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third, and they said: Lo! we have been sent unto you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When We sent them two messengers, they rejected them both, so We strengthened them with a third. They said, "Truly, we have been sent to you [by God] as messengers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: What time We sent Unto them two, then they belied the twain, wherefore We strengthened them with a third, and they said: verily we are Unto you the sent ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When We sent to them two [apostles], they impugned both of them. Then We reinforced them with a third, and they said, ‘We have indeed been sent to you.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When We (first) sent to them two messengers, they rejected them: But We strengthened them with a third: they said, "Truly, we have been sent on a mission to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When We sent to them two Messengers, they belied them both, so We reinforced them with a third, and they said: "Verily! We have been sent to you as Messengers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We sent to them two, but they belied them so We reinforced them with a third. They said: 'We have surely been sent as Messengers to you'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We sent them two messengers, but they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third. They said, “We are messengers to you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:14] When We sent to them two men, and they denied them both (from idh arsalnā ilayhim ithnayni fakadhdhabūhumā to the end is a substitution for the previous idh, ‘when’), so We reinforced [them] (read fa‘azaznā or fa-‘azzaznā, in other words, We reinforced the two men) with a third, and they said, ‘We have indeed been sent to you [by God]’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When We sent unto them twain) two apostles: Simon the Canaanite and Thomas, (and they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third) We strengthened them with Simon Peter who confirmed the message conveyed by the other two apostles, (and they said; Lo! we have been sent unto you. 497
